reviews.review: Pretty nice game
its fun

BioShock Infinite isn't just a game. It's an experience. From the unreal graphics to the incredible combat, this game will feel like so much more than just a game. You immerse yourself SO MUCH in this world that it becomes difficult to tell what's real life and what's not. Elizabeth is amazing too. Able to toss you ammo, health, and vigors whenever she finds them, she is actually useful, unlike 99.9% of NPCs in other games (SKYRIM!) 10/10, would reccomend to any fan of shooters.
This game was so much fun to play with an extrodinary plot line. Also Elizabeth is hot. 10/10

Tja, ob es mittlerweile noch viel über das Spiel zu sagen gibt, also außer wie AWESOME es ist?!? 
Vielleicht einfach mal nüchtern und objektiv probieren: 
Bioshock Infinite ist ein grundsolider FPS, die Spielmechanik und das Waffengefühl funktionieren einwandfrei und die zusätzlichen Kräfte (hier Vigors) geben eine zusätzliche taktische Komponente. 
Zusätzlich überzeugt Bioshock Infinite mit wahrlich atemberaubenden Art Design. Hierbei wurde die Welt nicht nur stimmig in Szene gesetzt, sondern auch Liebe zum Detail bewiesen. 
Dazu gibt es, was für Shooter eher selten geworden ist, noch eine packende Story, die auch genreübergreifend Vorbildlich geschrieben und inszeniert wurde. 

Also um das ganze 'Blabla' abzukürzen: klare Kaufempfehlungen, und das nicht nur für Fans guter FPS

I love this game! To think I had so very little interest in the series untill this one. I picked up the triliogy for a steal on the summer sale, becuase of all the great things Ive heard about 1 and 3 and honestly I got more than my monies worth out of just this game. 

The game its self is a pretty standard FPS. Its the story that keeps things going! I love the attention to detail in every thing. from the moment the game opens to the closing credits everything is done very well. If you listen and pay attention though you can figure out whats going on and what the plot is pretty quick but again you have to be on the ball from moment one. One of the things that hit me was the music and that is going to be my hint to all of you just keep an ear out for BGM and you will get a smile.
dANKEST GAME i EVER PLAYED.

Now this game is a really nice one to start with the First Person Shooter genre. This is also a really nice game to explore the world. Definatly one of the better games I've played in my gaming carrier.
Great art style and story, coupled with mediocre gameplay. The gameplay is so mediocre that it felt like I had to go bear playing it to finish the story itself.
One of my favorite games. Definitely recommended.

Habe mir das Spiel vor 2 Tagen gekauft da ich schon Bioshock 2 gespielt habe und mir das sehr gefallen hat. Ich kann nur sagen bisher haut mich das Spiel echt um. Spiele das Game auf Ultra und es sieht einfach klasse aus. Die Story ist wirklich top wie man es gewohnt ist von Bioshock und fesselt mich um so länger ich spiele immer mehr. Klasse finde ich auch das man bei den Charaktern im Gesicht ablesen kann was für eine Stimmung sie haben. Ich kann 100% Kaufempfehlung geben für diesen Titel und hoffe das bald wieder ein Bioshock Titel in dieser Qualität raus kommt.

10\10

I never gave the Bioshock games a chance. I always heard good things about the first one, but never got around to it. Same  for this one. I heard it was amazing, but just didn't care about it. Then I  saw it on sale a while back, and thought to myself: "everyone says it's such a good game, maybe I should try it." Man, am I glad I did. When it comes to FPS games, I never expect  much from the story. They're usually just quick campaigns put in to give players a weak experince when they want to take a break from multiplayer. Ah, multiplayer. After playing this game, I'm now sure that's why campaigns suck in games like CoD and BF. This game has no multiplayer, and honestly, I think it makes the game so much better than other shooters. Instead of a "One-and-done" story mode, you get a game that's actually worth another play. I don't want to spoil any of the story, because it's so good that people should experience it for themselves. All you need to know is it's a FPS with tight and responsive gunplay, a bit of magic thrown in (and it's actually usefull), beautiful graphics, and an amazing story. If you don't own this game, and you're thinking of buying it, do it. You won't regret it.

TL;DR  Buy the game.
fuckin song bird man,
Best story driven game I've ever played. Just can't get enough of it!

Il est parfois des jeux qui vous marquent, qui transcendent sans toutefois trahir leur nature de « simple » divertissement pour vous parler plus intimement et vous toucher, et BioShock Infinite est de ceux-là. Servi par un design extraordinaire, soutenu par des combats passionnants en dépit de quelques petits couacs, le titre d'Irrationnal Games donne surtout vie à une grande histoire, magique, prenante et impitoyable. A la fois plus et moins qu'un shooter, BioShock Infinite accroche et fascine tout en offrant une vision d'une rare intelligence, sans concession, sans manichéisme primaire, le tout serti dans un magnifique écrin. Bref, une chose est sûre, ceux qui s'envoleront pour Columbia ne sont pas près de remettre les pieds sur terre.

So after finishing this game I honestly don't see how it's so highly rated. Aside from the fact that it has a penalty for dying, every single aspect of the game is much worse than it was in Bioshock 1 and 2.

Story is full of plotholes and has a habit of biulding up characters and ideas, and then not doing anything with them, the worst offeders of this being [spoiler]Songbird and Fitzroy.[/spoiler]

Enemies are bullet sponges, exploration is mostly absent, Vigors can only be used a few times before you have to go find more salts, as opposed to the original where you could use plasmids dozens of times in a row if you had enough Eve hypos. The two-weaopn limit forces you to discard any good weapons you have once you're running out of ammo use whatever weapon happens to be nearby, even if it sucks. This also means that upgrading your weapons is a huge gamble since you can have to leave an upgraded weapon behind without knowing when you'll be able to use it again. Hell, you can have full ammo for that weapon and still be unable to use it.

Bottom line, it's a mediocre, overhyped game. Go play the original again instead of wasting your time and money on it.
Amazing.
Graphicly eye pleaseing, great story, awesome game play! I recomend it for sure.
Adorei o jogo, apesar do gameplay se tornar repetitivo (matar e destruir para chegar a algum lugar) a história do jogo é surpreendente, cheia de reviravoltas e com um final inesperado.
Muito bom, vale a pena jogar.      9/10
Эмоции Элизабет великолепны!
One day i'm gonna complete this game and you gonna regret it!!!!!

One of the rare games I can play atleast 5 times without getting bored with it. And everytime I play it I found out something new. Even if it's a little thing or a big like understand the story better. Even tho I've been quite out with the other Bioshock games, this is the best from all of them.

This is a game you should buy and play if you're even the slightest bit interested in games. The easy to pick, although sometimes convulted FPS combat, is always fun, as the game is constantly introducing new ways of mixing it up. This means, that by the end of the game, you're essentially pulling off first person combos and it feels fantastic. The meat and bones of the game is its story, which may sometimes fall a bit short of incredible, but matches the awe inspiring landscapes and huge set pieces in such an incredible way that you can forget about those little things. It wraps up nicely (although this is a story you might need to play twice to understand), and offers a nice amount of replayability, so it's definitely worth the price.

Ótimo jogo, muito boa a história e segue a mesma dedicação dos desenvolvedores ao se atentarem o desenrolar da historia com base nos dois primeiros títulos, mas com uma temática totalmente diferente aos anteriores, mas com muitas surpresas e revelações no final que o torna um jogo muito interessante. 
Para aqueles que jogaram bioshock 1 e 2, recomendo dar uma chance para este jogo, apesar de mudar a temática e a ambientação, ainda assim ira te surpreender no final.

If you're a bioshock fan looking for another bioshock game don't bother. They made some choices to gameplay that really make it feel less like a bioshock game and more like a call of duty game. The story is uninteresting and tries to hard to have a big shock towards the end. The enemies are boring and generic. The entire time it tries to shock you by having the game levels thick with old timey racism. We get it, America was racist and not all hunkey dory.

Having only two weapons available to you at a time really makes it feel like a waste upgrading them. Upgrading them is boring and doesnt make the weapon feel better like it did in the other games. Powers in this game are instead bought with money instead of adam, and are very uninteresting. I played the whole game never using them because they felt so tacky and pointless. Money in this game isnt scarce but you're better off saving it for your 50th bottle of salts and ammo for the one weapon you really liked but dont want to throw it away because you can't find enough ammo for it.

It's a pretty game and the gameplay is okay I guess. I'd probably like it if it wasnt meant to be a bioshock game honestly. Extremley over rated. I was severly disapointed with this game.

If you're looking for a generic fps this is pretty good. If you're looking for a bioshock game you wont find it here.

Azt kell mondjam, hog a legjbb rész volt. Áhh egy nagyon érdeke kaland, brutálisan jó sztorikkal. Aki mgteheti sale-k alaklmából pár euróért szerezze be  az egész sorozatot, nagyon megéri az árát. Zseniális sorozat 10/10. Ajánlom LADISTÁNAK MAXIMÁLISAN !!! :D

The game is very well made, stunning visuals, the AI controlled "Elizabeth" feels almost real.  The biggest downside that I saw was some of the extreme racist language in the game -  I can handle violence, gore, or swearing but the language that the developer chose interrupted my enjoyment of the game and it didn't really add anything to the plot.

[h1]BioShock Infinite поражает воображение старым, дедовским способом — за счет богатого воображения его авторов, которым удалось создать по-настоящему захватывающую историю, наполненную яркими образами, запоминающимися персонажами и резкими сюжетными поворотами. Идея города в небесах выглядит еще менее правдоподобной, чем идея города на океанском дне, но в этот заоблачный «диснейленд» веришь практически сразу и безоговорочно. Совокупность мелких, тщательно продуманных деталей, изящная экспозиция и в особенности то, как быстро этот диснейленд превращается в гитлерюгенд — конечно, в антиутопию куда проще поверить, чем в утопию.[/h1]

[h1]Геймплейно новый BioShock не сильно отличается от старых, и если вы играли в предыдущие части, то довольно быстро сможете насвистывать мотивы новой симфонии разрушения. Приличный набор винтажных пушек, которые прекрасно детализированы и сочно бабахают. Небольшой «магический» арсенал позволяет весьма зрелищно оглушать противников, очаровывать их или тупо поджигать; помимо прямого применения есть вариант создания ловушки. «Волшебная» одежда — местный аналог тоников — дает разные пассивные бонусы вроде короткой неуязвимости при пополнении здоровья или, скажем, шанса поджечь врага рукопашной атакой.[/h1]

[h1]В каждой локации залипаешь на несколько минут — не только потому, что есть шанс найти какие-нибудь ценные ресурсы, но и потому, что это такое продуманное пространство, полное бытовых деталей. Они рассказывают о жизни города не хуже радиопропаганды и многочисленных агитплакатов, без которых тут не обходится ни один пустырь. Когда Букеру и Элизабет удается в очередной раз ускользнуть от преследования, взору игрока предстают красноречивые сцены из жизни простых граждан, порой довольно жуткие. «Кладбищенских» аттракционов тут вообще немало, и по ходу повествования встречается несколько поистине жутких хоррор-моментов.[/h1]

[h1]10/10[/h1]

Откладывал пару лет покупку. В итоге взял на распродаже и остался очень доволен. Так как пропустил первые две части, от Infinite не ожидал ничего особо. А на самом деле оказался крайне интересный сюжет с хорошим финалом. И без QTE!

[h1]Bioshock Infinite[/h1]

A história acontece no ano de 1912, durante o crescimento do excepcionalismo americano, o jogo tem como protagonista  Booker DeWitt, que foi enviado para a cidade flutuante de Columbia com a missão de encontrar uma mulher (Elizabeth) e sanar sua dívida. O jogo tem uma duração de aproximadamente 9-12 horas de jogo (terminei com 10.6). Como todos os jogos da franquia, Bioshock Infinite é um First Person Shooter com alguns elementos de RPG, uma das coisas que eu mais gostei foi de Elizabeth com sua incrivel Inteligencia Artificial, durante as batalhas quando você está quase morrendo, ela joga pacotes de vida e sais (usados nas "magias") e também joga munições, já fora da batalha ela encontra moedas encondidas e lockpicks (gazúas) que vão te ajudar a abrir cofres e portas. A unica coisa que eu não gostei, foi os controles, como todo o jogo da franquia, o botão de mirar é o "T" ou o Scroll do Mouse, e o botão que usa as "magias" é o botão direito do mouse, mas isso você pode mudar nas configurações dos controles. Enfim, Bioshock Infinite é um jogo excelente, com gráficos lindíssimos, dublagens (em inglês) perfeitas e não é à toa que ganhou mais de 85 pré-lançamento na exibição da E3 de 2011 e uma nota de [url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/bioshock-infinite] 94/100 da Metacritic[/url]. Recomendo!

[b]Nota:[/b] 10/10

Hands down, best story I've ever had the pleasure of experiencing. After finishing the game I had to sit down and think about my life and then I was sad because I wanted more... over a year now and I still want more! Recomend this piece of art to everyone! It's simply amazing!

Great looking with fun gameplay. The vigors don't have the same narrative significance as plasmids did from the original, but they do add to the fun. Fleshed out and believable characters with solid voice acting. Another great story form the creators of the original Bioshock. Highly recommended.

Bioshock Infinite has nothing to do with the previous Bioshock titles. No Big Daddies, No Little Sisters, No Rapture. This title set us in Colombia, a floating city in the sky of North America. 

The story is amazing, fantastic! It is the main reason that drive me to play to the end. The city always feel alive as the game shows you the culture of Colombia, like where they work, what they do for entertainment, how they interact with the environment around you. The gameplay introduces a new mechanic in the franchise, a skyhook. You can use it to travel between levels or use it to take down enemies. 

The biggest thing about this game, is Elizabeth. She is the best companion in video games. The way she interact with her surrounding makes her alive. It is a joy to watch her amaze by the scenery, getting excited when she saw a group of dancers, warm herself near a fire. Thats it? No no no! She is essential to you in combat. She can assist you by opening tears, throw you some health, salts and ammo. Love her. 

But there are a few things I disappointed with. This installment water down the RPG elements in it which I dont prefer. The early trailer shows the Boys of Silence as if we are going to face them in combat but we only encounter them on 1 level and its a stealth level. A bad level. 

8/10. Elizabeth <3

Iba a hacer un análisis solo de esta entrega, pero me es imposible hacerlo sin hablar de las anteriores. Hay tantas cosas que me habría gustado que me dijeran a mi cuando empecé a jugar que no sé como intentar resumirlas, aun así voy a intentarlo:

¿Alguna vez has pensado que pasaría si en nuestra sociedad dominara únicamente el libre mercado o el conservadurismo extremo hasta tal punto de adorar a un lider como si fuera el creador de todo el universo? ¿Te gustaría mezclar esa idea en una historia que poco tiene que envidiarle a las de, por ejemplo, Christopher Nolan?

Esta ESPECTACULAR OBRA MAESTRA hará que desarrolles pensamiento critico o que lo reafirmes al ver como ciertas organizaciones económicas y políticas, si cayeran en el extremo, podrían convertir a nuestra sociedad en algo parecido a lo que es en esencia Rapture o Columbia. Todo esto la saga te lo va dejando caer bajo una trama increíble con unos personajes que harán que te identifiques con ellos.

¿Que cómo es capaz de llegar a hacerte dudar hasta sobre lo que creías que estaba bien y mal? Con la AMBIENTACIÓN, el que para mi es lo que lo hace grande. Cada sala, cada frase escrita en paredes, estatuas, emblemas... cada grabación (indispensables para entender la trama al completo), los kinetoscopios (algunos de ellos tan increíbles que te dejarán 5 minutos dándole vueltas al tema que plantean), los esquemas y dibujos que el decorado te va dejando caer y un largo etc que en cuanto empieces a jugarlo lo entenderás.

Si lo jugáis con tranquilidad y disfrutando el juego en vez de yendo a por objetivos y "siguiendo la flecha" casi con total seguridad se convertirá en una obra maestra también para vosotros.

Y para colmo, si aún sigues con mono de BioShock, siempre puedes leer "La rebelión de Atlas", libro en el que esta basado.

P.D: IMPRESCINDIBLES los dos DLC de Infinite para que te explote la cabeza y te quedes pasmado/a.

I agree with a lot of the criticism that has been directed at the combat system, but in addition to that I think that the backlash/disappointment is due to the game not being a type of game that many people want to play. It is a hectic first person shooter where the meat of the game is walking into several heavily signposted "combat arenas" and activating a high alert state that sees loads of enemies rushing you. It is assumed that you find the stress of these situations fun, so they added subsystems such as the skyrail and dimensional rifts to give you more options when you go into the middle of things. 

The biggest issue with the game is that there is too little incentive to "go into the middle of things" if you are not naturally inclined to play the game like that. A large subset of players (myself included) found the arenas stressful and attempted to cheese them with long distance shooting. Obviously, enabling aiming down sights was a misstep. The speed of the combat encounters should probably have been slower, to allow for more strategic thinking about how to apply the special abilities. The arena encounters should have been mixed up with stealth sections and puzzle solving, to take the player out of the constant fear of being ambushed that the game induces. They actually implemented one idea of how to force people out of cover, by dropping the almost invulnerable killer robots (Handymen) that chase you five or so times during the game, but it did not seem like the game prepared you enough for these encounters. Too much stick, too little carrot, really.
Très bon jeu !

Hab es gerade durchgespielt in...joa knapp 18 Stunden.

Das interessante bei dem Spiel ist, dass es unglaublich Storylastig ist und wirklich nur sehr wenige Cutscenes enthält.
Diese fügen sich zudem noch sehr gut ein und hinterlassen nicht den Eindruck, sie müssten übersprungen werden.

Die Geschichte ist sehr sehr gut geschrieben und man sollte sich echt Zeit dafür nehmen sie zu verstehen.
Das hier ist definitiv kein Spiel das man durchrushen sollte. Und wer es doch tut, hat das Prinzip von Spielen einfach nicht verstanden.

Grafisch und vom Aufbau her ähnelt es nicht so sehr den ersten beiden Bioshockteilen, aber das stört wirklich nicht, die Grafik ist hierbei aber hervorragend an die Atmosphäre angepasst.

Meiner Meinung nach ein absolutes Muss für Spieler die auf Story stehen aber auch beim Rumballern und Ausprobieren von Dingen nicht zu kurz kommen wollen.

Man muss zudem auch nicht die ersten beiden Bioshocks hierfür gespielt haben, würde ich aber trotzdem empfehlen.

Revised Review: I was very unfair to this game. While it starts to go off the rails near the conclusion, there are a lot of great moments and set-pieces that make the overall experience worth it. Still highly recommend playing the Burial At Sea DLC afterward, as it ties everything together better than the main campaign does.

Very fun game that doesn't require extensive knowledge of previous BioShock games (not having completed the previous two myself).  I found the gameplay to be pretty standard of your typical nuts and bolts shooter, but that's by no means a bad thing.  The emphasis on this game is in strong storytelling and writing.

Only complaint is that it's a bit short, but the fantastic DLC helps extend the playtime quite a bit.

Bioshock Infinite is an interesting game upon first glance, unlike it's predecessors, Bioshock Infinite does not take place in the well known Underwater City of Rapture, but in a never before seen city in the sky named Columbia. 

You would think that because the games strayed away from their more well known city of Rapture into Columbia that the developers were running out of ideas or something, but that is far from the truth!

Bioshock Infinite is a beautiful game, with an extremely addicting and wonderful in depth deep story that I believe is one of the best in terms of video game stories go.

There really isn't a ton that I can say about it without spoiling things, but just trust me when I say it is marvolous. 

The graphics of this game, while I am not overly concerned about graphics typically, this game looks gorgeous on High settings, heck even lower settings still look really nice! Columbia is the opposite of Rapture in more ways than location, because compared to the sometimes depressing and dark setting that is Rapture, Columbia has a bright, full of life, paradise sort of feel to it. And it's just wonderful to look at.

The gameplay is very similar to previous Bioshock games at it's core, but there are some changes in terms of Weapons and a few minor added gameplay mechanics. But overall the game will make you feel at home overall if you've played any other Bioshock games, just be prepared for a couple of different small changes, mostly in terms of weapons, such as the inability to carry all of your weapons at once. Salts also replace Plasmids, but are again pretty similar in terms of gameplay mechanics. 

Trust me when I say however that you will love this game, without spoiling anything. You will never want to leave Columbia, that beautiful city in the sky.
A success in storytelling and in game play.  Dealing with themes like religion and racism, the story is deep and perfectly paced. A solid follow-up and a great primer for future entries.
Gameplay is pretty nice. Inside the game, I encounter with variety of enermies that they make me feel energetic during gameplay. I would say it's one of my favorite games that I played over 15 hrs.
Unglaublich gut! Eines der wohl besten Spiele, die ich je gespielt habe! Auch sämtliche DLC's sind ein Muss (Season Pass lohnt sich da). Mit diesem Spiel kann man nichts falsch machen!
BEAUTIFUL GAME!!! 10/10

[b]80/100[/b]

This is not a Bioshock game. It does not feel nor plays anything like Bioshock 1 and 2.
 
Is it a good game? 

It's a quality game (big budget title), but it does not reach the depth of the previous titles and the whole atmosphere and feeling is completely different compared to the previous titles. This game feels more like 'Dishonored' part 2 title then a 'Bioshock' part 3 title.
 
That said, the game on it's own is an okay game with beautiful artwork, quality voice acting and sounds and same for the animations and general mechanics. It does feel to much like a dumbed down console game with shallow gameplay and handholding design. Not that the previous titles were that much hardcore or anything, but you did need to search and explore a lot more (using your brains) to complete a mission. With Infinite the game holds your hand from the beginning to the end to lead you through the linear path that was already placed (by design).
Just amazing,
Gioco, a mio parere, di una bellezza infinita. Alla pari del primo, se si parla di videogiochi che possono essere considerati forme d'arte, questo di sicuro ne è un esempio.

La jugabilidad es buena, la soundtrack la hostia y la historia es de las mejores, por no decir que es la mejor. Todo es importante desde el principio y no te das cuenta hasta el final.Nota: 9.9999999
PD: teneis que registrar en la basura para encontrar municion xD

The story is pretty neat, and the whole world is actually great feeling. First bioshock had a better theme though.

I played this before I played the original BioShock and this is the first game in years that I have stuck around to finish.

It's more open and fresher looking than the original and although some of the levels are a bit samey in terms of what you need to do in order to complete them it is still good fun.

It's also worth noting that the character who travels along with you for most missions (Elizabeth) is really helpful. She never gets in the way and will find you ammo and health packs when you really need them in the middle of a big battle. This is the way characters like this should be done in single player games and the developers have done well to get it right here.

There's a little too much 'walk up to every object in a room and press F to see if you can open it and pick up goodies' in it for my liking - something which I found spoils the flow of the game - but the mix of story and action scenes feel well balanced and I kept coming back for more.

Although people have said that the combat mechanism isn't that great I found it to be fine once I had settled on a few prefered weapons and vigor combinations.

Recommended.
El mejor del año!
ONE OF THE GREATES GAMES EVER MADE!

I had great time playing this game. Shooting enemies was fun, story was interesting to follow and the game looks beautiful!

If I had to find cons, there was some little bugs, e.g Elizabeth throwing salt/ammo/coin through wall. Also, I got stuck few times, whenever it was Elizabeth blocking the door and not moving, or me doing parkour-thingies and somehow managing to get stuck in a small gap, it was a bit annoying to load from the last checkpoint. 

But those weren't game breaking at all, so it's all good if a great game has a small bugs like that! 
Awesome game, would  totally recommend at least trying it if you like FPS games with great graphics and story.

This was the single best story based FPS I have ever had the privelage to play! A solid story that makes you wish it hadn't ended. The combat system is a change to the norm, with the ability to place down traps and sneak up on enemys. the battlefield becomes highly diverse. I look forward to the next story, the next adventure and the next vigor!

Esse foi o primeiro BioShock que eu completei, e não tenho nada além de coisas boas para falar sobre esse game. 
E algumas delas são:

-Ótima jogabilidade e criatividade, você realmente sente diferença em cada arma, no jeito de atirar, no som e na estratégia em usar cada uma delas. De uma cidade flutuante, um enigma sobre universos pararelos, e até o design e históra de fundo de cada inimigo especial (como o Handyman, Boy of Silence e principalmente, Songbird!). É tudo muito bem feito, desafiador e inovador, eu diria.

-A trilha sonora e a atmosfera do jogo também se destaca e muito, são músicas com clima antigo e muito bem escolhidas, boas de se ouvir (como aquele quarteto [url=www.youtube.com/watch?v=jUffPtS3-7A]cantando "God Only Knows" a capella[/url], no inicio do jogo). 

Mas o que realmente sacudiu a minha mente foi a história, o enredo que, por causa de sua imersão e profundidade (também complexidade) vai te deixar pensando por uns dias depois de terminar o jogo.

Enfim, ótimo jogo, vale muito a pena!

Simplemente impresionante, esa manera de jugar con el continuo espacio tiempo y la profundidad de los personajes es increible, además de tener unos gráficos maravillosos y una banda sonora magnifica 11/10, 101% recomendado xD
Less RPG centric than previous installments but an excellent story. I highly recommend this game.

Ich müsste lügen wenn ich sage das es sich als Shooter besonders gut spielt.
Trotzdem ist es ein Pflichtkauf, die Atmosphäre mit absolut großartig gestalteten Charakteren, einer gut erzählten Geschichte mit einem genialen Mindfuck-Ende machen alle schwächen die das Gameplay an einigen Stellen aufweißt wieder wett.
9,5/10 would buy again
